newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Clinton to mark 50th anniversary of Marshall Plan.
newsitem.headline: Clinton to mark 50th anniversary of Marshall Plan.

text.p: President Bill Clinton will address European leaders next week to mark the 50th anniversary of U.S. aid to war-torn Europe under the Marshall Plan, the Dutch government said on Friday.
Clinton arrives in the Netherlands late on Tuesday for summit talks with the Dutch European Union presidency.
After adressing 52 European government leaders and heads of state in The Hague on Wednesday he will unveil a statue of the plan's architect, George Marshall, in Rotterdam that evening.
A statement from the Dutch government information service said Clinton would be accompanied in Rotterdam by Dutch crown prince Willem Alexander. He will also meet Dutch Queen Beatrix.

First lady Hillary Rodham Clinton will arrive separately in the Netherlands early on Tuesday for a tour of Amsterdam -- including the hiding place of Jewish war diarist Anne Frank -- before joining her husband in the Hague, the government said. The Clintons will leave the Netherlands on Thursday morning.
